Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1888, 0.04, 0.1263] Next, create a new sketch with a single coordinate plane defined by the created coordinate system. This sketch will have two faces, each with a circular loop. The first face will have the following loop: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: [0.0612, 0.0612] - Radius: 0.0612 The second face will have the following loop: - Loop 1: - Circle 1: - Center: [0.0612, 0.4362] - Radius: 0.0612 After the sketch is created, perform a scaling operation with a scale factor of 0.4975. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system transformation. Then, extrude the scaled 2D sketch along its normal by 0.04 units, and further in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.0 units. The operation for integrating this part with the preceding CAD model is to create a new solid body. Part 2: Rectangular Prism with Rounded Corners Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.04, 0.0] Next, create a new sketch and draw a rectangle with the following edges: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.5, 0.0] to [0.5, 0.75] - Line 3: [0.5, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] After the sketch is created, perform a scaling operation with a scale factor of 0.75. Next, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system transformation. Then, extrude the scaled 2D sketch along its normal by 0.0 units and further in the opposite direction of the normal by 0.1 units. The operation for integrating this part with the preceding CAD model is to join the existing body. Final Shape The final shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width, and the length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side.</description>
